---=Wiki=----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Firemen's Ball (Czech: HorÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â­, mÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¡ panenko) is a 1967 film directed by MiloÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Â¦Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¡ Forman. It is set at the annual ball of a small town's volunteer fire department, and the plot consists of a collection of anecdotes told within that setting. The film uses no actors - the firemen portrayed are the firemen of the small town where it is set.[citation needed]

The Fireman's Ball was the last film Forman would make in his native Czechoslovakia. It is also the first film he shot in color, and a milestone of the Czech New Wave.
